description: The Implementing Cisco Network Security Show will help prepare the viewer for IINS Exam 210-260 exam by describing, discussing and demonstrating security principles and practices used by the CCNA Security professional.  This show will feature episodes with secure network infrastructure, understanding core security concepts, managing secure access, VPN encryption, firewalls, intrusion prevention, web and email content security, and endpoint security.  It will also include troubleshooting and monitoring of secure cisco networks devices.  If you're already a CCENT or CCNA R+S and want to specialize in security, the CCNA Security show help you to get started!

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie continue their discussion of common security threats, this time looking at some countermeasures. They discuss identifying malware through packet capture utilities like Wireshark and NetFlow. They then jump into the world of Intrusion Detection/Prevention Systems(IDS/IPS) and next generation IDS/IPS/Firewalls to block incoming attacks, discussing Cisco Source Fire, Firepower, FireSight. Finally, they explore exfiltration or the avenues of data loss.

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie continue their discussion of Secure Management Access; this time they explore Role Based Access Control(RBAC) which allows you to set the "view" a user sees based on their function or role in an organization. Also, they demonstrate how to enable using encrypted protocols like SSH for remote access.

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie continue configuring a Cisco ASA. They pick back up by looking at what can be configured in the ASA using the ASDM. This includes things like NAT, DHCP, Routing, User Accounts, Firewall rules, and VPN access. They also describe the different modes of deployment, and methods of implementing high-availability. Also covered is the Modular Policy Framework or MPF.

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie dive into the world of endpoint security. They start by describing mitigation technology for email based and web based threats. Next they go over blacklisting, URL filtering, malware scanning, and TLS decryption. Then they discuss anti-malware/antivirus software, personal firewalls, and encryption.
